Curator's comments: Label text Mamluk war drum Brass inlaid with silver Egypt early 14th century Brass kettledrum engraved and inlaid with silver throughout. Decorated with an Arabic inscription which refers to an unnamed amir and medallions containing the fleur de lys, an early Mamluk blazon. Apart from their use during battles, Mamluk war drums are associated with ceremonial parades in Cairo in honour of sultans or amirs and they were played in a tablakhana, a loggia used for musical ensembles. They were normally covered by animal skin and played with a drumstick. 1966,1019,1. Brooke Sewell Permanent Fund
